Operational transformation (OT), part 1

20 Apr 2014

Operational transformation (OT) is a really cool algorithm for conflict-free editing of a shared document. It was popularized by Google Wave and later integrated into Google Docs.

In this series of posts I'll share what I learned about the algorithm while building a collaborative code editor (pairjam.com)

Note: this is both a long boring series and mostly a rehash of an excellent article by Daniel Spiewak.

Motivation

Suppose we have two users who are concurrently editing the following shared document:

abcd

This document is drier than an old gluestick, but it'll demonstrate all of the core concepts.

There are two parts to operational transformation:

  • The actual transforms
  • The control strategy
